meanings.definition: To reverse one's previous position or opinion.
meanings.sent1: She backpedalled on her decision to go to the party.
meanings.sent2: He quickly backpedalled when he realized his mistake.
meanings.sent3: The politician backpedalled on his promise to lower taxes.
meanings.sent4: After the argument, she backpedalled and admitted she was wrong.
meanings.sent5: The student backpedalled on his essay topic after receiving feedback.

meanings.definition: To retreat or withdraw from a situation.
meanings.sent1: The soldier backpedalled when the enemy advanced.
meanings.sent2: Feeling overwhelmed, she backpedalled from the challenging project.
meanings.sent3: The cat backpedalled from the vacuum cleaner's noise.
meanings.sent4: He backpedalled from the argument to avoid further conflict.
meanings.sent5: The team backpedalled to regroup and come up with a new strategy.

meanings.definition: To pedal backwards on a bicycle.
meanings.sent1: He backpedalled to slow down before making the turn.
meanings.sent2: She backpedalled cautiously to avoid hitting the curb.
meanings.sent3: The child backpedalled to show off his biking skills.
meanings.sent4: The cyclist backpedalled to adjust the bike's position.
meanings.sent5: They backpedalled smoothly to maintain balance while riding.
